thread.title: Boy hit by car thanks Hingham police with handmade card - Local news
thread.title_full: Boy hit by car thanks Hingham police with handmade card - Local news

author: boston.com
title: Boy hit by car thanks Hingham police with handmade card - Local news
text:
A 5 year-old boy hit by a car in Hingham last week made a touching card, complete with colorful drawings, to thank the officers who helped him. Police shared the hand-drawn note on Facebook.
Related Link Grab a tissue before reading this get-well note two kids taped to a cop’s door
 Luke Hansen is in a wheelchair after a driver hit him in a crosswalk, breaking his ankle, reports CBS Boston . Hingham police officers comforted Luke until EMTs arrived at the scene.
“It means more to the average officer than an official commendation,” Hingham Police Sergeant Steven Dearth told CBS Boston. “Those are the things we like, the things we bring home and share with our families, and we share among the department. So that’s really special.”
